answers.answer: I say...talking to your Dr is your best bet. Since you are older than 35 you have a slightly higher risk for some things...but the best advise I can give is talk to your Dr about all of this. He/she will help set your mind at ease and will know more about all those questions

Hello, welcome to the forum--and congratulations!  All of your concerns you need not worry.  Your age is fine, previous abortions have no connection with complications in pregnancy.  Miscarriages are very common, and women on this forum have had up to 7 and have become pregnant and delivered children...preclampsia may be a slight concern, but no indication that you would have it again.  I'm certain you'll be just fine.  Speak with your dr, but no need to worry--enjoy your pregnancy!  Pam

Thank you for the quick responses hulahutgirl and PamelaBee...PamelaBee, I've had 5 abortions and 1 miscarriage.  Carrying a healthy baby to full term after the abortions is what concerns me.  Do you know of anyone who have had this many and have had successful healthy births and babies?Also, what about Down Syndrome and other defects? Am I at more of risk on those?

Hi,early abortion is not so different from D&C. Some women have quite a few of these due to recurrent pregnancy losses and still go on to have a subsequent healthy pregnancy.  Things should be fine.  Just speak to your doctor about your concerns.  THey should also monitor your cervix to make sure there are no problems there.  But these can also be addressed if they are looked for early.Your risk for down syndrome and other defects are also pretty low.  But the baby can be screened for these later in the pregnancy.

Yes, I had a couple gilfriends in highschool and college that had more than a few abortions and currently have healthy grown children today.  As sally mentioned an abortion is really a D&C, and unless you have other complications within your uterine lining and cervix you should be completely fine, and deliver a healthy baby to term or thereabouts.Don't worry : )

Hi there,Just wanted to chime in and let you know that an abortion performed surgically with no complications rarely has any negative impact on a pregnancy.  I had several miscarriages prior to having my son (at 40) and had to have a few d&c's as a result.  There was no problem.I say rarely cause a problem because in a few cases (and this is not common), scar tissue can develop that can sometimes impact ability to carry.  However, my understanding is this impacts implantation and typically results in a chemical pregnancy or very early miscarriage (before 6 weeks).  So it sounds like things are great.  And again, it is not common to have this happen.Do make sure you are honest with your Dr. when giving your history.  Never be ashamed of earlier decisions.  It is legal and you did what you felt was right at the time.  It is important for your Dr. to know your history, and not their place to be judgemental.Congrats on your pregnancy, and I wish you a healthy and happy 9 months!!
I had 2 VERY healthy baby girls at age 37 (almost 38)  and 38 (almost 39)  You will be fine.(((((hugs))))))
Oh and I forgot to mention I had gestational diabetes with both and hypertension with the 2nd.Noooo problems :)
Congratulations. I wish you all the best for the next few months.

You will be fine, I know its hard not to worry about it. I had gestational with number 4 and number 6. I have 6 kids. And pregnant with number 7, so I just made a  vow to myself that i want eat sweets until the weekend. I already eat whole wheat pasta, whole wheat pancakes, and bread. My doctor told me know pregnancy is the same. Oh I think I was about to develop preeclampsia with number 5, but I had to deliver him earlier(2 months early). But I do have high blood pressure currently. I think you we are already consider high risk because of our age (over 35)Enjoy your pregnancy!!!!!!

question: Hello all - I'm fairly new to the boards.  Just had my first ultrasound on Friday and baby is good! Heart beat of 138 beats per minute.  This was a nice surprise after doc thought I had a possible ectopic or miscarriage coming up because a week prior nothing was seen on the ultrasound.  So I feel blessed!I have some concerns though and have not yet talked to my doctor about them.  I'm truly hoping that you will have some good advice for me and I'm hoping that I'm not judged at all for what I'm about to say.I'm 36 (will be 37 at time of birth) and have a few (5) abortions under my belt.  All were done surgically before 8 weeks.  I know that this sounds horrible but I need everyone to understand that at the time it was the right thing for me to do.  I'm now in a loving/healthy relationship and want to have a baby with the man that I love.  I do have one child who is a teenager and I have had one miscarriage.  I also had preclampsia with my child and was induced a week early.I'm just concerned that given my history:* age (36/37) years old* 5 abortions* 1 miscarriage* preclampsia in previous pregnancyAm I able to possibly give birth to a healthy child? Or should I be seeing a high risk doctor?  Should I be concerned about birth defects, etc.?I'm just in a state of panic and want to know if it's considered safe to carry a child with all that is under my belt and what are the odds of having a healthy pregnancy and baby?Once again, I did not come here to be judged for my past.  I'm looking for as much support as possible for my future.Thank you all in advance!
title: Is it safe to have a baby? No negative comments please...
